name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Saad* – By oath of the renowned Qur’an, (Alphabet of the Arabic language; Allah and to whomever He reveals, know their precise meanings.)

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: In fact, the disbelievers are in false pride and opposition.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Many a generation We did destroy before them – thereupon they cried out whereas it is not the time to escape!

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And they were surprised that a Herald of Warning came to them from among themselves; and the disbelievers said, “He is a magician, a great liar!”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “Has he made all the Gods into One God? This is really something very strange!”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And their leaders went about, “Leave him and cling steadfastly to your Gods! Indeed he has a hidden objective in this!”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “We never heard of this even in Christianity, the latest religion; this is clearly a newly fabricated matter.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “Is the Qur’an which is sent to him, among us?” In fact they are in a doubt concerning My Book; in fact, they have not yet tasted My punishment.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Or do they hold the treasures of the mercy of your Lord, the Almighty, the Great Bestower?

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, for them? So would they not just ascend using ropes?

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: This is just one of the disgraced armies, that will be routed there and then.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Before them, the people of Nooh had denied, and the tribe of A’ad, and Firaun who used to crucify.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And the tribe of Thamud, and the people of Lut, and the People of the Woods; these are the groups.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: None of them was such that it did not deny the Noble Messengers, therefore My punishment became inevitable.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: They await just one Scream, which no one can avert.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And they said, “Our Lord! Give us our share quickly, before the Day of Reckoning.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Have patience upon what they say, and remember Our bondman Dawud, the one blessed with favours; he is indeed most inclined (towards His Lord).

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Indeed We subjected the hills to say the praise with him, at night and at morn.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And birds gathered together; they were all obedient to him.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and just speech.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And did the news of the two disputants reach you? When they scaled over the wall into Dawud’s mosque.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: When they entered upon David, so he feared them – they said, “Do not fear! We are two disputants, one of whom has wronged the other, therefore judge fairly between us and do not judge unjustly – and show us the right way.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “This is my brother; he has ninety nine ewes and I have one ewe; and he now says ‘Give that one also to me’ – and he is very demanding in speech.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Said Dawud, “He is indeed being unjust to you in that he demands to add your ewe to his ewes; and indeed most partners wrong one another, except those who believe and do good deeds – and they are very few!” Thereupon Dawud realised that We had tested him, so he sought forgiveness from his Lord, and fell prostrate and inclined (towards his Lord). (Command of Prostration # 10)

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: We therefore forgave him this; and indeed for him in Our presence are, surely, proximity and an excellent abode.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “O Dawud! We have indeed appointed you as a Viceroy in the earth, therefore judge between mankind with the truth, and do not follow desire for it will lead you astray from Allah’s path; indeed for those who stray away from Allah’s path is a severe punishment, because they forgot the Day of Reckoning.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And We have not created the heaven and the earth and all that is between them without purpose; this is what the disbelievers assume; therefore ruin is for the disbelievers, by the fire.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Shall We make those who believe and do good deeds equal to those who spread turmoil in the earth? Or shall We equate the pious with the disobedient?

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: This is a Book which We have sent down upon you, a blessed Book, for them to ponder upon its verses, and for men of intellect to accept advice.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And We bestowed Sulaiman to Dawud; what an excellent bondman! He is indeed most inclined.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: When fast footed steeds were presented to him at evening.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Therefore Sulaiman said, “I cherish the love of these horses*, out of remembrance of my Lord”; he then ordered them to be raced until they vanished in a curtain out of sight. (To be used in holy war.)

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: He then ordered, “Bring them back to me”; and he began caressing their shins and necks.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And We indeed tested Sulaiman, and placed a dead body on his throne – he therefore inclined towards His Lord.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: He said, “My Lord! Forgive me and bestow upon me a kingdom, which shall not befit anyone after me; indeed only You are the Great Bestower.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: We therefore gave the wind under his control, moving steadily by his command wherever he wished.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And made the demons subservient to him, all builders and divers.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And other demons bound in chains.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “This is Our bestowal – you may therefore bestow favours or withhold them – you will not be questioned.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And indeed for him in Our presence are, surely, proximity and an excellent abode.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And remember Our bondman Ayyub (Job); when he cried out* to his Lord, “The devil has struck me with hardship and pain.” (After seven years of patience.)

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: We said to him, “Strike the earth with your foot; this cool spring is for bathing and drinking.” (A spring of gushed forth when he struck the earth – this was a miracle.)

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And We bestowed his household to him and one more similar to it – as a mercy from Us, and as a remembrance for the people of intellect.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And We said, “Take a broom in your hand and strike her with it, and do not break your vow”; We indeed found him patiently enduring; what an excellent bondman! He is indeed most inclined.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And remember Our bondmen Ibrahim, and Ishaq, and Yaqub – the men of power and knowledge.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: We indeed gave them distinction with a genuine affair – the remembrance of the (everlasting) abode.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And in Our sight, they are indeed the chosen ones, the beloved.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And remember Ismail and Yasa’a (Elisha) and Zul-Kifl; and they are all excellent.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: This is an advice; and indeed for the pious is an excellent abode.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Everlasting Gardens – all its gates are open for them.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Reclining on pillows, in it they ask for fruits and drinks in plenty.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And with them are the pure spouses, who do not set gaze upon men except their husbands, of single age.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: This is the promise being given to you, for the Day of Reckoning.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Indeed this is Our sustenance, which will never end.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: This is for the virtuous; and indeed for the rebellious is a wretched destination.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Hell; which they shall enter; what an evil resting-place!

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: This is for the criminals – so that they may taste it – boiling hot water and pus.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And similar other punishments in pairs.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “Here is another group that was with you, falling along with you”; they will answer, “Do not give them plenty of open space; they surely have to enter the fire – let them also be confined!”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: The followers will say, “In fact, for you! May you not get open space! It is you who brought this calamity upon us!” So what a wretched destination.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: They say, “Our Lord! Whoever has brought this calamity upon us – double the punishment of the fire for him!”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: And they say, “What is the matter with us that we do not see the men whom we thought were evil?”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “Did we mock at them or did our eyes turn away from them?”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Indeed this is really true – the people of the hell quarrelling among themselves.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Proclaim (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “I am purely a Herald of Warning – and there is no God except Allah, the One, the All Dominant.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them – the Almighty, the Oft Forgiving.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Say, “That is a great tidings.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “You are neglectful of it!”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “What did I know of the heavenly world, when the angels had disputed.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “I receive only the divine revelations, that I am purely a clear Herald of Warning.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: (Remember) When your Lord said to the angels, “I will create a human from clay.” –

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “So when I have perfected him and breathed into him a spirit from Myself, (you all) fall down before him in prostration.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: So all the angels prostrated, every one, without exception.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Except Iblis; he was proud and was, from the beginning, a disbeliever.

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Said Allah, “O Iblis! What prevented you from prostrating before one whom I have created with My hands*? Have you become proud or were you haughty from the beginning?” (Used as a metaphor).

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Said Iblis, “I am better than him; You made me from fire, and You have created him from clay!”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: He said, “Therefore exit from heaven, for you have been outcast.” (To disrespect the Prophets – peace and blessings be upon them – is blasphemy.)

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “And indeed My curse is upon you till the Day of Judgement.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: He said, “My Lord! Therefore give me respite till the day when all will be raised.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Said Allah, “You are therefore among those given respite.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “Until the time of the known day.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: He said, “Therefore, by oath of Your honour, I will surely mislead all of them.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “Except Your chosen bondmen among them.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Said Allah, “So this is the truth; and I speak only the truth.” –

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “That I will fill hell with you and with those among them who follow you, all together.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: Say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) “I do not ask any fee from you for the Qur’an, and I am not a fabricator.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “It is not but an advice for the entire world.”

name: Ahmed Raza Khan
text: “And you will come to know of its tidings, after a while.”
